title: Two-year-old shot in crossfire in Minneapolis is identified; no arrest yet
content:
MINNEAPOLIS -- The two-year-old fatally shot while in a minivan in Minneapolis on Friday lived in St. Paul, according to the Hennepin County medical examiner’s office.
The boy was identified by the medical examiner’s office Sunday night as Le’Vonte King Jason Jones.
After being shot in the chest at about 11:30 a.m. at Penn Avenue North and Lowry Avenue North, the boy was taken to North Memorial Medical Center, where he was pronounced dead shortly after noon, according to the medical examiner’s office.
A 15-month-old in the minivan was also struck but suffered injuries that weren’t life-threatening, according to police.
KSTP-TV reported that the child, Melia Jones, was the boy’s sister and was released from the hospital Saturday after being treated for a gunshot wound to the leg.
Police said the shooting was not random; it appeared to be the result of gunfire between people who knew each other.
Police had yet to make any arrests in the shooting, Minneapolis police spokesman Sgt. John Elder said Sunday night.
